column4: it is a choice of hardware functionality over package compatibility. a lot of things dont run so well (or at all) in 64
which distro did you try last time and how long ago?
there have been vast improvements within that time frame.
as with most new hardware, there is a bit of a lag before it operates smoothly on *nix or *bsd. unless it is a particularly popular piece of hardware where someone will hack something up asap
